thinking.disposable_income: The neighborhood has relatively high disposable income with a median household income over $100,000, indicating residents can generally absorb higher transportation costs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have significant discretionary spending power and tend to prioritize quality of life amenities, with many high-end retail and dining establishments in the area.
thinking.accessibility: The area has good road access with I-10 and Memorial Drive, decent bus service, and is relatively close to downtown, though many residents are car-dependent despite some walkable sections along Washington Ave.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given high income levels, prioritized policies that optimize travel time over cost savings 2) Selected options with moderate to higher driver fees to reduce congestion on major corridors 3) Balanced tax rates to maintain service quality while not overly burdening retail/dining businesses 4) Chose moderate transit fares to encourage ridership while maintaining service quality 5) Considered that most residents drive but want improved transit options as complementary transportation
